intro: Peristera grossularioides, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces orange to yellow berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
